creditline: Gift of the Gabriel P, and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg Collection
description: abstract image with intersecting black lines across middle and center, creating segements of yellow, green, pink and orange/brown
inscription: verso, both upper and R frame pieces in black marker: 1982 c | verso, UL on framer\'s sticker in blue ink: G Weisberg
markings: verso, UL, white sticker: Kulicke Frames, Inc. / 1700 Madison Avenue / New York 12, New York / tel: Algonquin 4-0140
text: Gabe Weisberg is a major figure in the study of 19th-century French art—a prolific author, editor, curator, and highly respected connoisseur. He and his wife Yvonne are also avid collectors of French and Belgian art, primarily Naturalist and Realist drawings. Gabe approaches all his endeavors with the eye of an artist. Indeed, as a young man he trained as an artist before focusing on the academic side of his studies.
title: Abstraction
